conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, which are illuminated by a light source, casting A, B, C and D on the ground.
The light source is currently positioned somewhere above these objects.
Shadow position is determined by the angle between the light source, object, and ground.
Shadow size is affected by how directly overhead the light source is positioned.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source movement.
conclusion: If the light source moves forward, shadow A will move backward (away from the light source).

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows become smaller as the light source gets closer to being directly above the objects.
conclusion: The shadow A will become smaller as the light source gets more directly above the object.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source movement.
conclusion: Shadow B will move backward, away from the direction of the light source movement.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows become smaller as the light source gets closer to being directly above the objects.
conclusion: Shadow B will become smaller for the same reason as shadow A.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source movement.
conclusion: Shadow C will also move backward, opposite to the light source movement.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows become smaller as the light source gets closer to being directly above the objects.
conclusion: Shadow C will become smaller as the light source becomes more overhead.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source movement.
conclusion: Shadow D will move backward, away from the light movement direction.

premise: When a light source moves forward above objects, shadows become smaller as the light source gets closer to being directly above the objects.
conclusion: Shadow D will become smaller as the light source becomes more directly above.

premise: If the light source moves forward above the objects, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move backward, in the opposite direction of the light source movement. All shadows will become smaller in size as the light source gets closer to being directly above the objects.
conclusion: A, B, C and D shift backward and become shorter and smaller.
